basics.name: Rich Leyshon
basics.label: Senior Data Scientist / Ai Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Ai Engineer, specialising in applied agentic and generative Ai, WSGI web applications, Ai observability, geospatial modelling, and production-grade analytical systems. Reimagining public sector delivery through responsible Ai adoption.

work.name: Ministry of Justice – Ai Justice Unit
work.summary: Ai Engineer responsible for scaling national Ai services, building observability platforms, and developing applied agentic Ai solutions.
highlights: Justice Transcribe
Senior Ai engineer on Justice Transcribe, automating probation meeting documentation using Ai transcription and LLM-generated summaries.
Scaled the service from a 300-user pilot to a national rollout for 40,000 probation officers, enabling consistent, compliant meeting records.
Delivered 34,000+ transcriptions and summaries by Nov 2025 with a 4.7/5 average satisfaction score.
Added robust engineering practices including automated tests, coverage reporting, dependency validation, and secure CI/CD workflows.
Ai Observability & Langfuse Platform
Maintainer of the Unit's Langfuse observability backend, supporting monitoring and evaluation of all LLM completions across the directorate.
Deployed a self-hosted Langfuse instance in Azure using Terraform and Helm, with automated SSL (cert-manager + Let's Encrypt), DNS delegation, and hardened networking.
Built comprehensive LLM quality monitoring pipelines: async context tracing, prompt versioning, latency and cost dashboards, and LLM-as-a-judge evaluation.
Engineered reliable LLM integration pipelines using Vertex Ai and Azure Cognitive Services with structured output, retry/fallback logic, and content moderation.
Governance & Capability
Delivered interactive technical capability workshops on test-driven development to Justice Digital data scientists.

work.name: Office for National Statistics – Data Science Campus
work.position: Senior Data Scientist, Strategic Tools & Technologies Team
work.summary: Managed data science teams to innovate and deliver on emerging analytical priorities and tools. Delivering quality-assured systems and granular, applied geospatial analysis at national scale.
highlights: Led work on urban public transport performance across UK and international cities, delivering a reproducible toolkit for measuring transport network performance internationally.
Secured £0.5 million in HMRC Economic Innovation Fund funding by personally writing a successful research bid for innovation in local transport statistics.
Chaired the working group producing ONS Campus guidance on open-source development standards, leading to the publication of the ONS Campus Open Source Development Guidance.

Lead on research partnership with Alan Turing Institute, applying constrained optimisation research using agent-based modelling and network analysis to evaluate Local Authority progress against the UK Levelling Up agenda policy priorities.
Expert panellist at The Alan Turing Institute's 'Policy Priorities & Ai for SDGs'.
Scrum Master certified, experienced in Agile DSDM project management, kanban and Gantt.

work.name: Office for National Statistics – Data Science Campus
work.position: Head of Faculty & Data Science Lecturer, Campus Faculty
work.summary: Lecturer and faculty lead delivering training and capability building across the UK public sector and international NSOs.
highlights: Promoted to Faculty Lead, managing a multi-disciplinary service delivery team in preparation for a 5× expansion of the Cross Government Data Science Graduate Training Programme.

Led development of advanced geospatial training in collaboration with Ordnance Survey, including preparation of advanced geospatial course content for UK government departments, Caribbean statistical offices, and Kenya National Bureau of Statistics.
Guest speaker at Royal Statistical Society 2020 and 2021 conferences on transparency, reproducibility in national statistics and UK Data Science as a global public good.

work.name: Data Cymru
work.summary: Automation and secure ETL development for local authority datasets.
highlights: Automated survey analysis and parameterised reporting in R Markdown.
Quality Assurance of Local Authority redistribution modelling in Python.
Developed ETL pipelines powering secure updates of children’s care placement data for Welsh authorities, combining Power BI frontend with Python ETL pipeline.

work.name: Wales Audit Office
work.summary: Automated analytics for audit, fraud detection, and performance review.
highlights: Automated counter-fraud testing of general ledger transactions.
Developed Power BI dashboards and automated R Markdown reporting.
Delivered Power BI training nationally to internal and external stakeholders.

work.name: St Illtyd's, Fitzalan, and Bassaleg High Schools
work.summary: Teacher of Science delivering biology, chemistry and physics to A-level standard.
highlights: Curated differentiated materials to support varied learning needs.
Developed advanced communication, time management and conflict resolution skills.
Experienced in the effective communication of technical subject matter to diverse student audiences.

Data analysis tools and data science methodologies
